SLOGAN: Smoke form validation and components for Bootstrap
GITHUB: Smoke is open source. It's hosted, developed, and maintained on GitHub.
DESIGNED: Designed and developed with love by

GETTING-STARTED-DESC: An overview of Smoke, how to download and use.
DOWNLOAD-DESC: Download Smoke and add it to your project. It's simple and quick to use.
WHATS-INCLUDED-DESC: Once downloaded, unzip the .zip file to see the structure of Smoke. You will see something like this:
REQUIRED-DESC: To work, Smoke plugin requires these two libraries:
REQUIRED-JQUERY: Note that the Smoke plugin requires that the jQuery library is included.
REQUIRED-BOOTSTRAP: Note that the Smoke plugin requires the Bootstrap 3 framework to be included.
BASIC-TEMPLATE-DESC: Start with this HTML basic template or modify it to your needs.
BASIC-TEMPLATE-DESC2: Copy the HTML code below to get started with the minimum requirements of Smoke.
LANGUAGE-DESC: To change the language of validation messages, Add in the html the needed script.
VALIDATE-DESC: It makes the form validation on client side easy, simple and safer.
FORM-DESC: To validate a form the function used is smkValidate(). This function supports JQuery, Angular and Select2.
CUSTOMIZE-ICON-DESC: Customize the error icon by adding the data-smk-icon within the etiquette form.
INPUT-DESC: The field types supported so far are text, textarea, email, password, select, radio, checkbox, number, color, date, datetime, time, month, week, tel, url, search and range.
INPUT-NOTE: It is necessary that the input to validate has the form-control class and it is inside a div with the form-group class.
INPUT-NOTE-DISABLED: If the input has disabled attribute, it will be not validated.
CUSTOMIZE-MESSAGE-DESC: Customize the error message by adding the data-smk-msg within the etiquette input.
INPUT-EMPTY-DESC: To validate a field that is mandatory, you only have to add the required attribute within the input.
INPUT-EMAIL-DESC: To validate an email account, the field must be of type email.
INPUT-ALPHANUMERIC-DESC: To validate a field that accepts only numbers and letters, the field must be of type text, add the data-smk-type attribute and within this the alphanumeric property.
INPUT-NUMBER-DESC: To validate that a field only accepts numbers, the field must be of type text or type number, if it is of type text add the data-smk-type attribute and within this, the number attribute.
INPUT-NUMBERRANGE-DESC: To validate a field that only accepts numbers and within in a range, the field must be of type text, add the data-smk-type and within this, the number attribute, also add the data-smk-min and data-smk-max attributes to indicate the range allowed.
INPUT-DECIMAL-DESC: To validate a field that only accepts decimal numbers, that field must be of type text, add the data-smk-type and within this, the decimal attribute.
INPUT-CURRENCY-DESC: To validate a field that only accepts numbers, commas, dots, ie a currency format, the field must be of type text, add the data-smk-type attribute and within this, the currency property.
NUMBER-CHARACTER-DESC: To validate a field that only accept a certain number of characters, add the minLength and maxlength attributes and within these the number of characters allowed.
RANGE-CHARACTER-DESC: To validate a field that only accepts a range of a number of characters, add the minLength and maxlength attributes and within these, the range of number of characters allowed.
STRONG-PASSWORD-DESC: To validate a field that accepts only a strong and secure password, the field must be of type password, add the data-smk-strongPass attribute and within this, the hard level required.

DESCS.MEDIUM: 6 alphanumeric characters and at least one of them must to be numerical
DESCS.STRONG: 6 characters minimum, combining numbers and lowercase and uppercase letters.

EQUAL-PASSWORD-DESC: To validate the texts contained in two fields are equal, Add the required attribute within the etiquette input in the first field. The function used is $.smkEqualPass().
EQUAL-PASSWORD-VAR-DESC: To validate that the text content of a field is equal to the value of a JavaScript variable, add the required attribute within the etiquette input . The function used is $.smkEqualPass().
INPUT-URL-DESC: To validate an url, the field must be of type url.
INPUT-TEL-DESC: To validate an phone, the field must be of type tel.
INPUT-COLOR-DESC: To validate an color, the field must be of type color.
INPUT-DATE-DESC: To validate an date, the field must be of type date.
INPUT-DATETIME-DESC: To validate an date and time, the field must be of type datetime.
INPUT-TIME-DESC: To validate an time, the field must be of type time.
INPUT-MONTH-DESC: To validate an month, the field must be of type month.
INPUT-WEEK-DESC: To validate an week, the field must be of type week.
CLEAR-FORM-DESC: To clean forms use the smkClear() function. For not cleaning one or more fields, use the attribute data-smk-noclear within the etiquette input.
COMPONENTS-DESC: Create funcional and coloful Alert or confirmations messages and its use is as simple as the natives of javascript.
ALERTS-DESC: It provides alert messages for the typical user actions when invoking an event.

ALERTS-TB.DESC: Customize alerts, changing the message, color, duration or if the alert will be permanent.

DESCS.TIME: Duration of the alert in seconds

CONFIRMATION-DESC: It provides a confirmation message for the typical users actions when invoke an event.

CONFIRMATION-TB.DESC: Customize the confirmations, changing the message and the text on the buttons.

CONFIRMATION-PROMPT-DESC: It provides a confirmation prompt message for the typical users actions when invoke an event.
PROGRESSBAR-DESC: Add a progress bar to your application.
PROGRESSBAR-DESC2: Add a progress bar to your application in any event.

PROGRESSBAR-TB.DESC: Customize the element in which the progress bar will be added. Define when it starts and when it finishes.

DESCS.ELEMENT: Element which will add the progressBar
DESCS.STATUS: When it starts and when finishes

FULLSCREEN-DESC: Add Fullscreen Functionality to your application.
FULLSCREEN-DESC2: Add a full-screen button, and the content will occupy the full space of its container.
PANEL-DESC2: Add functionality to your panels, minimizing,expanding or removing them.

PANEL-TB.DESC: Customize the buttons that you want to show.

STRING-FLOAT-DESC: Converts a string to a float value.
NUMBER-CURRENCY-DESC: Converts a number to currency format.
NUMBER-CURRENCY-NOTE: This function takes two parameters, the first is the number to be formatted and the second is the prefix or the currency.
URL-NOTE: This function takes a parameter (optional) is the number of folders to get  the URL after.
DATE-DESC: With this function you can get, format, translate and customize dates
DATE-DIFF-DESC: Get the difference between two dates
